Reviews.Title: “Great overall stay!”
Reviews.Author: nick s
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the staff very courteous and helpful, the room was great (deluxe room), free wifi. Though the hotel is on a side street off of Rue de Rivoli and I did hear the garbage trucks one morning (lasted about 10-15 minutes around 8 am), it was relatively quite from my room on the 5th floor. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean with a bit of old tired charm”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: The location of the Mayfair could not be better. Yes, it is noisy--you are steps away from Rue de Rivoli and Paris traffic will definitely be heard through the double pane windows. If this is a problem, then the hotel may not be the best choice. I stayed in a single room (32)--the bathroom was sparkling clean, the room clearly also well attended though one does notice that the carpet is well past its expiration date and the wall paper past its prime. Even with these slight blemishes, the hotel manages to have a certain charm. The turn down service was a lovely touch, though it missed a chocolate on the pillow. The price of the hotel is determined by its location and its charming elegance without the extravagant prices that can be attached to such places in Paris. I would stay there again though I might ask for an interior room. Also, the rack rates of the hotel seem absolutely high for what it offers, but if there are special rates then I would consider staying here again. The bed was very firm, the sheets very smooth and the pillows comfortable though not top of the line and not what we are now used to get at the big American chains. For a European independent hotel, they were more than adequate (and I am fussy). If you like to sink into a soft bed, you would be disappointed. The service was indeed very good and, for Paris, incredibly \welcoming. If you request a cab to the CDG airport, opt for the flat fee one. Because the hotel calls the cab and you pay for the fare of the cab arriving at the hotel, you will find that it is a less expensive option. Overall, I was would stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Emilio R
Reviews.Content: I am Italian, and I stay quiet often in Paris for business. I have just discovered this hotel. It really has an elegant decoration and atmosphere. I was upgraded and I really appreciate it. The lady serving the breakfast is Brazilian and she provides a good service with a big smile, which is not always true in Paris! Finally, I can walk to Boulevard Haussmann where my company is. I will certainly come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, comfort and more”
Reviews.Author: terry10016
Reviews.Content: I stay at this lovely boutique hotel whenever I am on business in Paris. The location is ideal and the hotel staff make you feel very welcome and comfortable. The rooms are comfortable and clean as well. They serve a lovely breakfast and are next to a popular cafe that offers room service to the hotel. I have sent friends to the hotel on my recommendation and they have always been very positive about the experience. The hotel makes you feel at home which is a nice touch and unexpected when you are far away. I cannot say enough good things about the staff and their dedication to making you feel comfortable during your stay. The location is ideal for restaurants, parks, museums, etc. This hotel is a little treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Alchymist
Reviews.Content: I just returned back from Paris, still full of impressions from this charming city and amazing Hotel Mayfair. It was my second stay there and definitely not the last one. This time I stayed for 6 nights and this place filled my trip with luxury and comfort since the very first moment …I highly recommend this hotel to everyone looking for an elegant French style, perfect service and great location. The Mayfair is very well located, just a few steps from Place de la Concorde and Jardin des Tuileries (metro and bus stations in a few minutes). The location is very calm; although you are in the heart of Paris you won’t be disturbed by traffic noise. One of the highest benefits represent the hotel staff – very professional, helpful and friendly, always smiling and important thing for all of us non-French speaking guests – with an excellent knowledge of English language. This approach and very warm and comfortable interior creates so welcoming atmosphere that you are always happy to return back…

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good breakfast. Great location! Can talk to Louvre, museums, great restaurants and just down the block from a Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: LuMatos
Reviews.Content: tha best location in Paris! the staff is nice and helpful. the room was a bit small,but was very clean and with a beautiful bathroom. i would come back again because the location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: wanabechef
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mayfair twice I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris. The location simply can't be beat. Yes, as other reviewers have said it is not a 4 star hotel. You are also not paying a 4 star price. It does however have wonderful staff, clean as a whistle and they will upgrade your room if one is available. Comments about noise, well, Paris is noisy. Can't say anything about breakfast as we never got up in time to have it. Close to everything you want to see, do and eat in Paris. If you expect a "Hilton" type experience this one is not for you. If you want to be steeped in the culture of the city stay here. I would also recommend their car hire service from the airport if you are a first time visitor to Paris and not familiar with the metro system. Worth every Euro after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayfair is near the Rue de Rivoli and Jardin de Tuileries and Place de laConcorde -- ideal location! We had a "family room" which consisted of two twin beds plus a pull out couch in a suite-like two room layout, which worked out perfectly for two adults and two small children (7 and 9 years old). The bathroom was very spacious with both a shower and a huge jacuzzi tub. Overall the service was good. Breakfast was terribly overpriced, so I would not recommend that. If you need a taxi, allow lots of extra time because it takes a while for the staff to call one.

Reviews.Title: “very shady ; noise starts at 7am”
Reviews.Author: xenead
Reviews.Content: Located on a back street where the only view is the garbage collection from the Westin Hotel. Horrible noise which is a combo of 7am trash removal and 8am hammering from the building next door undergoing construction. Internet access is a hit or miss. No hair conditioner in the bathroom. Beds are hard and pillows lumpy. Breakfast is stingy. All in all a terrible experience. At most a 2-star hotel. Go somewhere else, there are plenty of other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ignacio100B
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find in Paris a more dedicated and friendly staff as you will find in the Hotel Mayfair. The location is great. Across the street you will find Jardin des Tuileries. One and a half block away is Place Vendome. Going the other way is Place de la Concorde. Some of the most interesting places in Paris are in walking distance. My wife and I are looking forward to our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: CakeNine
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week in Paris, we cannot stop raving about what a terrific hotel the Mayfair was. Its location is ideal--we were within a few minutes' walk of just about everything we wanted to get to, including the Metro, the Louvre, the Musee D'orsay, the Place de la Concorde, Place Vendome, etc. Its an opulent neighborhood but the Mayfair fit in while also feeling friendly and welcoming. Our room was much larger than I'd expected, and we had a balcony with a view of the Tuilleries. The whole hotel was sparkling clean and the staff was kind and extremely polite. They made restaurant reservations for us, answered our questions, accepted my less-than-perfect French but also spoke English (and many other languages). It's true that breakfast is a bit pricey, but no more so than any other place in the immediate area (and less expensive than at the Imperial Cafe at the corner). Best of all, it is a hotel with character--if you want a standard American chain hotel, stay at the Westin next door. But if you want a small, friendly, charming hotel that makes you feel like a welcome guest, you'll like the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Kooklitsa
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week in Paris - nov 9th to Nov 16th The hotel corresponded to the old Parisian look we were looking for , but not its advertised high rank. The receptionnist , is arrogant and unaccommadating. The Mayfair hotel was in the middle of some exterior renovations while we were there , which woke us up early every morning.The WI_FI connextion was charged at 70 euros a week , although it was advertised to be part of the deal when you booked.. On the good side , the rooms , even tiny , are clean et the bathrooms impeccable and modern. This hotel is mid distance between the Louvre and Place de la Concorde , which is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scorchy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed in a great location in the heart of Paris, in addition I had an upgrade to a junior suite. Therefore it was a great room, with a sparkling new bathroom. BUT I hated the view of the wall a meter away and just a glimpse of sky eight floors up. If you are claustrophobic it could be an issue. On the plus side, I had a very silent night. The staff and service was friendly and smiley, which is nice and does make a change in Paris. Breakfast - 20Euros for the buffet, which, in line with other hotels in Paris, is rather steep for the offer available. Some building works were going on (ground floor conference room renovation) so there was some noise after 9 in the morning. This was not explained on booking but explained on arrival and clearly marked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: CUinSF
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Mayfair for its great location, nearly on the steps on the Tuilleries, and a short distance from the Louvre, the Palais Royale and other major attractions. The room was large and traditionally furnished, with lots of storage space for our 4 large suitcases; it never felt crowded or cramped. The furnishings were fairly high level and in relatively good shape, if a bit dated. The bathroom, while clean and functional, could use an update, and the layout of the lav/ vanity was quite inconvenient to other fixtures in the room. Service was dependable if not somewhat aloof; the restaurant, which is dark and quite over-furnished, provides a large but expensive breakfast; we chose to dine out for lunch and dinners. The best feature of this hotel would be its location, and convenience to the many sights and charms of this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but not a 4 star hotel by any means”
Reviews.Author: Lindsjoyr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in October 2011 and the location is indeed great, but it is not a 4 star hotel IMHO. Our window looked out to an air shaft and it was impossible to tell what the weather was that day. The decor is old and the room is not large but ok; the bathroom is updated which we appreciated. Breakfast is not included and Wi Fi is 10 Euro a day which is a complete rip off since it doesn't cost the hotel anything extra to offer it. It's not even offered for free in the common areas and you have to pay to access the Internet from the business center. I would probably not stay here again unless the price was much lower.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central, Nice to the Kids”
Reviews.Author: briaryoga
Reviews.Content: We have four children and needed to have two bedrooms. We were given a king size bed with a twin pullout in each room, with a little room to move around. The room was facing the street, and although we did hear the recycle truck every morning, the room was very clean, well stocked with shampoo, soap, towels, floor mat and we were able to see a reflection of the Eiffel Tower from the windows across the street. The staff all spoke English, and they had other staff who spoke Spanish, German, Italian and what looked like some kind of Arabic and Russian languages. We had room service and the breakfast buffet, the food was tasty but we were not presented with a bill upon delivery. I am not sure if this is customary. We were billed at the end of the stay, and were not billed for exactly what we ordered, but the bill was less than if we had been charged correctly. They gave us the option at checkout to pay with Euros or US Dollars. We would recommend this hotel for its great location. It was a half block from the Tuileries with a great playground and trampoline. It was an easy walk to the Louve, all of the museums we visited were free for our children under 10 years old. If we went back we would probably not go to the buffet, there is a cafe on the corner where the food looked better. They were more tolerant of four children than some people we encountered in Paris, and for that I was grateful.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the centre of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Paris traffic and crowds! This boutique hotel was classy yet homely, with reception staff friendly and helpful, breakfast provided in quiet room, room large with separate bathroom and separate toilet, cleanliness exceptional, and the position was very central. We were able to walk to the Champs Elysee, Eiffel Tower, in fact all the major attractions. The restaurant next door was excellent for dinner with great food and service. We could not fault the service at the Mayfair and the price for accommodation in the centre of Paris was reasonable. We would definitely stay here next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kcbn
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay here was lovely. The staff were patient as we tried to converse with them in French (they all know English!), the location was absolutely perfect, the room was large by European city standards, the view over the street was lovely and the place so quiet (soundproofed?) that you did not feel as though you were in the center of Paris when you were inside the hotel. This is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very small!”
Reviews.Author: Karenthelibrarian
Reviews.Content: Pros- It was in a good area. Staff were nice and spoke English. Cons-I had a single room that was very small, with a twin bed. The television was small. I had a hard time getting out of the bathtub. They didn't have a bath mat, so I asked them for one and they gave one to me. It made it much easier to get out of the tub. I wouldn't go back there because of the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , great rates”
Reviews.Author: opus11
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nites here based on trip advisor reports and was all we expected. Comfortable redecorated modern room , facing inner courtyard. Our friends had a streetside location and did find it much noisier- thanks to Westin garbage trucks at nite. Good little breakfast offered extra by the friendliest lady, Terresa?, Love this location, next to Tuilerie garden, 10 min walk to Louvre, all the shopping you can stand within 10 minutes . Would go back, no question!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: marcieme
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Not all of the front desk people understand English so asking for directions was difficult. Room was clean and quiet. Breakfast and wifi are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Tabeus-Npt
Reviews.Content: Selecting any unfamiliar or non-chain hotel is a bit of a risk, especially in an unfamiliar city. We chose the Hotel Mayfair for a week-long visit based on web site reviews and proximity to significant landmarks. I can happily report that this was simply a stellar choice. The location is excellent (steps from the Louvre, Tuileries gardens, Concorde, Vendome, Madeline, Foubourg St-Honore, and most importantly, several Metro stops), the rooms are plenty big (we had a deluxe double with a surprisingly big bathroom), and the decor is comfortable and authentic. Fancy without being pretentious. Perhaps more essential to us (as Americans with minimal French between us), the entire staff was extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful (and English-speaking), without exception. Overall a great home base for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be staying here when next in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AussieJess12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mayfair for three nights in a Deluxe Double room. It was a beautiful, large room with a separate toilet from the bathroom (very handy). The bed was very comfortable, and there was even a second door between the hallway and the bedroom which made it very quiet. The bathroom(s) were lovely and very well equipped. The hotel WiFi wasnâ€™t free which was a shame, especially as it didnâ€™t work very well. We hate paying a fortune for breakfast so we had the continental breakfast for 14 Euros (pretty much just toast and yogurt). The staff were nice and quite helpful (though English was a bit hard for a few of them). The location is really great with lots of restaurants/shops close by and 10 minutes walk to the Louvre, 25 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower, and 30 minutes walk to Notre Dame. Overall a really nice hotel which was much much nicer than I was expecting given the bad reviews of Paris hotels in general.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and ambiance EVER”
Reviews.Author: dawnaross
Reviews.Content: Mayfair is close to all the best of Paris. The staff is extreemly accomodating, are all English speaking, and very willing to please in a genuine manner. The breakfast is extraordinary. The rooms are clean and spacious. It is the former home of the man who wrote the French national anthem- so it is steeped in history. We are going back this year!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rich46503
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. We had a family room which was a good size and well furnished. Hotel staff all very friendly and helpful. Closely place de Concorde so within easy walking distance of louvre, champs d'elysse etc. Plenty of good restaurants nearby for evening meals. Hotel Mayfair deserves it's 4 star rating, we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: TR7Basingstoke
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better location, just a 10 minute walk to the Louvre, 3 minutes to the Place de la Concorde and the nearest Metro. The rooms were a good size (for European travellers) and were stylishly furnished and always very clean. The only downside was the small breakfast room and the rather expensive breakfast but don't let this put you off as there is a great cafe serving good quality and reasonably priced breakfasts on the corner of the street no more than 10 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to get back there again.”
Reviews.Author: splang
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. It is in a perfect location for seeing all the sights. We walked everywhere! The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We had a beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little gem in a fabulous neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel084
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a mom & daughter trip to Paris and booked the Hotel Mayfair mostly for it's great location being just a short walk to the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. The hotel exceeded our expectations and the staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful and welcoming. We especially appreciated the warm greetings from Daniel, as well as the room upgrade to a Jr. Suite, and the patient help from Laurence when we had internet difficulties with out Ipad. She was also kind enough to print out our airport boarding passes before we left. Yes, Paris is very expensive but I felt that Hotel Mayfair was reasonably priced with a great location and a terrific staff. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “It's too bad this hotel isn't as wonderful as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: MCronin7
Reviews.Content: First off, it's very expensive, which is not particular to this hotel, but Paris in general. And L'Hotel Mayfair is in the heart of Le Premier Arondissement, so The Mayfair should be expensive. However, when you throw $300 a night for a dorm-sized single, I think it is fair to expect GREAT service. The front desk was a hassle, and very rude about every request, such as a wake-up call or a taxi service. You can rent a laptop for e-mail purposes for 50 Euro/30 mins, which is absurd! So I asked the front desk to print out a ticket I needed to go to La Musee d'Orsay, and they took forever to do it, and I ended up just snapping a screenshot of myiPhone and showed it to the clerks at the museum, and luckily that worked. You can go to any hostel in town and get 30 minutes of internet for 3 euro. Which is what I suggest if you are forced to stay here. However, the cleaning staff and concierges were excellent and accomodating, it is the front desk who tries their hardest to ruin your stay in this beautiful and storied city. Thankfully, my trip wasn't ruined by the management; my remedy was to be at this hotel for the least amount of time I could, and because there are so many extraordinary things to do in Paris, this was easy. Very disappointed by the people and fees at this supposedly posh hotel. Lower your noses a little bit, and do your job, which is HOSPITALITY.

Reviews.Title: “Will return - no question!”
Reviews.Author: CBroman
Reviews.Content: I was going to start this with "location, location, location," however, this Hotel is much much more. The staff, and I mean the entire staff, always greeted you with a SINCERE smile and were ALWAYS willing to help (forget your notion of Parisians being "distant"). Cleanliness of the hotel? As an ex-military man.. 100% GO! Back to the location.. a short 3-5 minute walk to the Concorde metro station (and the Oblilisk), a 10-15 minute walk through the park to either the Louvre or D'Orsay and a number of very good restaurants from 1-5 minutes away. Louise, who serves breakfasts in the hotel, is a real charm. The breakfast is very good, but to be honest, we returned each morning because she made us feel right-at-home prior to a long day in the city. My family with DEFINATELY be returning to the Mayfair in the future. I would recommend this hotel to all and it should be within TripAdvisors top 50 of Paris without question.

Reviews.Title: “Very French....Very Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: ErieKeyWest
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel. Super cute, walking distance to many attractions. The staff kindly ungraded us to a room with a balcony so we were able to enjoy the sounds of the city from 5 stories up. Nice, big, very clean bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Never got to stay at the hotel as they cancelled my stay 2 days before arrival!”
Reviews.Author: SuperSunnyR
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Mayfair Paris back in March in order to visit Paris (18-22 July) with a friend who was coming all the way from California, only to receive an email on Saturday 16 July from the hotel reception to inform me that "they are no longer able to welcome us at their hotel and they have booked us into another hotel 'Hotel Victoires Opera'!!!! where in the world is that even acceptable? How can they decide for me where to stay (I managed to look quickly at the reviews of the Victoires Opera and needless to say they were all awful), after all the time I spent in reading hotel reviews in Paris in order to make sure my friend and I stay some place nice and also pay reasonably by booking much more in advance. There was no way I could find a nice hotel in Paris at a reasonable price, so last minute and so I had to go ahead and again after much research as to finding a nice place to stay at an affordable price (most places were fully booked - no surprises there!), I managed to find a nice 4-star hotel at a rate of 280Eur/night, which is OF COURSE much more than I intended to pay! I have requested the hotel to contact me and apart from a useless email from someone at the front desk, I have not heard anything back from a senior member of staff! This level of customer service is nont only unacceptable but it has ruined my mood, my holiday plans and have also forced me to pay more for something that I did not have to pay as much since I organised my trip months ago!!!! I booked my hotel through hotels-paris.fr. They have contacted me to let me know that the crappy hotel that Mayfair hotel Paris has booked for me must have been good enough and it is indeed my fault to have refused to stay there!! Customer service in europe makes me sick! Only americans really know and respect value of their customers. This experience has left a very sour taste in my mouth and I recommend you all NOT to book through hotels-paris.fr and not plan your stay with Mayfair Hotel Paris. THIS IS RIDICULOUS TO SAY THE LEAST!

Reviews.Title: “"Fabulous location"”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineT2011
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous hotel was impeccably clean and had all the amenities you could need. The rooms are smallish but you could open the doors to the balcony and step outside to watch people coming and going down on the streets below. The hotel was only a 20 min walk tfrom Champes Elysee in one direction or 10 min walk to La Louvre in the other. If you wanted to venture further it was only a very short walk to the nearest Metro (Concorde) station, and for a couple of euro you could travel all over Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, pleasure to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Katerina12
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week in da double room. It was very spacious comparing to many our hotels in England, very comfy bed, good size bathroom. Everything was very clean and tidy. Breakfast quality was great - good variety and fresh. All staff at the hotel speak English and different languages as well. Staff was very helpful and approachable. hotel is very close to all main attractions ( walking distance). Very quiet at night. The only thing that if you are travelling with small kids a breakfast room is on a smaller side - not much space to put a high chair ( though we stayed without kids this time), but I am sure they can accommodate request when needed. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0915
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel in the best area in Paris. Across from Louvre and 1 min from the fountains in Place Concorde. Small room but quiet. Didn't try breakfast but it looked good. Lots of nice restaurants and bistros in the area. The location makes this the hotel of choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, great location”
Reviews.Author: sd_doubled
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights at the end of a business trip. When we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised with the size and decor of the lobby and lounge. Check in was uneventful and soon we were on our way to the rooms. My room was nice for the price/location in Paris. Keep in mind that Paris is not cheap and this is not the Ritz. My bed was a double, nice for one person and cozy for 2. There was a nice sized armoire and desk. The room was average or above average in terms of cleanliness and the condition of the furniture. My room had a small balcony that looked out to the street. It was a nice touch and a great view of the street. The location is nice. Walking distance to the Louvre, Champs-Elysee, and the metro. The streets in this area are full of shops, restaurants, etc. I will stay here again if I get the chance and it is my first recommendation to anyone who asks me where to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Little Problems”
Reviews.Author: WFleet
Reviews.Content: Good location, but for the money, there were too many little problems that added up to a big headache. Broken luggage rack, broken hair dryer, broken sink, wrong bill when I checked out, wrong information about getting a taxi to the airport, housekeeping took my personal pillow, vacuuming outside my door in the early morning hours...lots of little things drove me nuts. The rate is too expensive for so many little problems. Internet is 10 euros per day; breakfast is 20 euros per day. For rates like this, I expect some attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sacto71
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my solo trip to Paris an absolute dream! I booked a single standard through a package with Air France and asked ahead if I could please get a room with a street view and balcony. Room 42 is amazing! Double bed, safe, mini fridge, nice size closet, heat & A/C. View of the tops of the trees in the Tuileries! Rue de Rivoli is close but once you shut the balcony doors, no issues with noise. The location was so central. I could pop back during the day for a mid day break. I walked more than expected after realizing just how close so many attractions were. I took bus line 24 the morning I headed to Notre Dame, what a breeze! The staff was amazing, so helpful! Breakfast was included and it was adequate. Too pricey for the 14 Euros they charge if separate for what you get. I can't say enough about this hotel. The in room wifi was expensive at 10 Euros a day, for the price of the room, it should really be included. It was an additional 9 Euro for 30 min for use of the business center as I did have to print documents a few times, over priced as well in my opinion. One thing to be aware of is the restaurants are very expensive in the 1st so be prepared. I knew that going in so did go over to Franprix a few times to pick up pre-made sandwiches for an inexpensive in room meal here and there. If you can get this through a package deal, you must!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: vancouverpatricia
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'suite' and were given a large room and small antechamber on the top floor which was badly in need of renovation. The carpet was stained in many places; the walls were stained throughout; the plastic flowers added nothing to the decor, and the room was dark. When we asked to be moved to a renovated room it was done but not graciously. We were in Paris for 4 nights and while the second room they gave us was pleasant indeed at 390 Euro a night and 450 euro for the dismal suite I expected something better. The breakfast was fine and the location for my meeting at the Louvre was great. , Michael , Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Not what it looks like on hotel's website”
Reviews.Author: gulinur
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel were nice and pleasant. Check -in was quick, luggage was delivered in to the room right away. 10 euro for Internet per day. We had breakfast buffet, which was OK - bread, butter, cheese, salami, fruits, yogurt, eggs. Room was big and the bathroom was clean. The location is perfect - major attractions are within walking distance. My only problem with hotel is photo shopped images of the room on their website. Rooms look polished and brand new on photos. In reality rooms hasn't been updated for a long time. The wallpaper, carpet, nightstands were all in need of replacement. Management needs to address this issue. I agree with previous comments - it is not 4 star hotel. Be aware of the room with a view of courtyard - all you'll see is 3 concrete walls. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect space in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sahuna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room and it was refreshingly large for a room in Paris. The hotel staff was very welcoming and the stay was very relaxing. The location was perfect, in walking distance from the Louvre and many other sites! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovefoodtravel10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of February for our honeymoon and had a superior room. The hotel is close to everything, we were able to walk everywhere including across the siene to the notre dame, st germaine area, etc. Paris is like NYC in that places seem far aren't because there's so much to see along the way. The hotel staff spoke English and were very helpful with all of our questions. The breakfast is quite expensive so we decided to venture out for breakfast, but all of Paris is pricey. We liked this hotel but might stay in a livelier neighborhood next time. We are not party animals or clubgoers by any means, but we do enjoy going to restaurants and people-watching. This neighborhood gets very quiet in the evenings. We would recommend staying on the left bank for more reasonably priced dining and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: laurenpilbeam
Reviews.Content: Hotel: I got back from Paris yesterday and I stayed at the Mayfair with my husband for our first anniversary. Upon arriving we checked into a standard room (may have been called superior, I cant remember) The room was very clean and well presented and had everything you would expect. (safe, huge wardrobe, TV etc) and the bathroom was huge! It had a bath and a shower and was bright and super clean! We also ate breakfast at the hotel on the last morning and it was very nice. Location: the hotel is situated almost half way between the Arch de Triomphe and the Louvre. Although they are both a bit of a walk away. at least 20 minutes in either direction. If I can give anyone a piece of advise it would be to give the metro (Paris's underground train system) a try. For around 11 Euros each you can get a book of 10 single trip tickets. much cheaper than buying lots of individual tickets! for goodness sake don't get taxis everywhere. you will pay up to Â£20 for a short journey. the metro is so easy to use and meant we saw lots in the day and a half we were there because it is so quick. Concorde metro station is just over the road from the hotel and is on the same line as the the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Paris Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: StellarpointCEO
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel to use as a base of operations for 3-4 days to see the city of Paris. The location can't be beat - two blocks from the Place de la Concorde and a major metro interchange. Unless you are planning to spend huge amounts of time in your room or at the hotel's spa, don't waste your money on some of the more overpriced 5 star hotels. I would suggest splurging on a deluxe room. It is absolutely worth the extra money. Don't expect any great views - but if you walk 3 minutes from the Hotel's front door - you will have some of the best views in Paris. The staff was very friendly and professional and they all speak English. The deluxe room is very spacious by European standards and the bathroom included both a bath and a full size shower. I have stayed at numerous hotels in Paris - including some of the top ones - so if money is no object stay down the strret; however, for the price, this is the best "Bang for your Buck" hotel in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: SarahL22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Mayfair for two nights over half term and can't recommend it highly enough. Staff were lovely and very friendly. The room was super and a very nice size for myself and my husband and son. Very clean hotel with a lovely lobby. We shall be going back!! :)

Reviews.Title: “bestens”
Reviews.Author: blumenstruck
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Perfect mix of French decor (toile, high ceilings,French doors/windows to balcony overlooking the Tuilleries) with modern amenities( all marble bathroom and flat screen). We had a deluxe room and it was lovely. Right off Rue de Rivoli near many pricier hotels. Great location ; many cafes, 8 min. to Louvre, 2 min. to Concorde, 5 min. to Madeleine. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Purdys271110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mayfair during November 2010. The location is excellent and we found the staff friendly and the accommodation clean, bright and comfortable. We would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a special little hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but the rest is very average.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel but, the rest of it is very average. For over â‚¬200 per night you would expect more. The decor is pretty outdated and the beds are not comfortable. The service is not great. The staff were nice but, their knowledge and recommendations were lacking. We changed rooms a few times as we were not happy with the standard and eventually had to accept one in the end. The walls are also very thin and you can here clearly the people in the rooms next door. The bathroom products are also dated and old fashioned. They were not able to recommend any places to eat and had little information for guests when we asked. The bar and reception areas are also old and outdated and have no vibe. I would recommend other hotels I have reviewed in Paris such as Le Bellechasse or the Royal St Honore Hotel. I would not recommend the hotel for more than â‚¬150 per night only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRVLALOT_9
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great staff, I've stayed here three times over the past few years and have nothing but good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quality rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: 32999BigAl
Reviews.Content: For our first stay in Paris, we lucked out at the Hotel Mayfair. It was part of an Air France package. We paid for a deluxe double, and it was worth the cost, as the room was spacious by Paris standards. The location was great for walking anywhere; try the Tuleries gardens at sunset. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and all spoke English. Also, we ate several meals and had evening drinks at the Imperial Cafe on the same block as the hotel. Great cafe food and drink, reasonably priced for Paris,and great people-watching spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ExploreSavannah!
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was perfect and only a short walk to major sites and the Metro. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. Their dinner recommendations were right with what we were looking for. The bathrooms was large even for US hotels with lots of hot water and a long soaking tub. The in room safe as wide enough for my netbook. The restaurant next door had a wonder steak frites and Beef Bourguignon. My goodness pastry shops everywhere. We are ready to go back to Paris right now. Okay maybe after the strikes. Bobby & Cindy Savannah GA

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: MiddletownNJMaryann
Reviews.Content: A charming small hotel with a perfect location. A friendly, caring staff wanting to please. On a quiet street just off the rue de Rivoli and a very short walk to the Tuilleries. All the comforts of a 5 star hotel. My 2 daughters and I found this to be a "Hidden Gem".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: freeflight
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel in a great location near the Place de la Concord and the Tuilleries.It within walking distance from the Louvre and near 2 metro stations. Service is good and rooms, though small, are clean and perfectly adequate. So I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jan48420
Reviews.Content: This is a charming and elegant hotel just off the Rue Rivoli and across from the Tuilleries. It is in a great location near more expensive hotels like the Ritz ,Meurice and right next door to the Westin. 10 minute walk to the Louvre,2 minutes to Concorde, 5 to Madeleine. Many stores and restaurants in area. We booked a deluxe room, and it was wonderful; beautifully decorated, toile, French country, high ceilings, tall windows that opened onto a small balcony with a view of the Tuilleries. The bathroom was all marble tile and new, and there was a flat screen tv. It was a perfect combination of French charm and modern amenities. We booked early so had excellent value for the area and accommodations.One small criticism is lack of coffeemaker in room. Otherwise, this is a lovely hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Pricey but good.”
Reviews.Author: Timothy_Foote
Reviews.Content: When in Paris for a weekend, the most important part of a hotel would seem to be location. Hotel Mayfair was in an excellent position, very close to the Place de la Concorde and therefore the Metro. It was a short walk to La Louvre also. The hotel is clean, and the service is fine. The rooms are not glamorous (well ours wasn't anyway) but they are fine. We didn't eat in the restaurant, either for dinner or breakfast, partly because it seemed expensive for what it was and also because there are thousands of excellent places across Paris. So I can't comment on the food. The place was quite expensive for what it was, but it was a "safe pair of hands". A place nice enough to take the wife for an anniversary. Location is the real selling point though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: need_to_travel_m0re
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and loved the hotel! Located on side street between Rue de Rivoli and Honore. Across from Tuilleries and within easy walking distance to metro, Place de Concorde, Place Vendome, Louvre, Musee de l'Orangerie, Musee d'Orsay, and Seine. Beautiful room on 4th floor with king bed, large bathroom. Overlooking inner courtyard so no view, but also very quiet. Nice breakfast buffet and many restaurants within walking distance of hotel. Accommodating staff who also spoke English. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “mayfair paris”
Reviews.Author: BATIGONZ
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service... Needs better maintenance, (ALL) pillows very dirty and old. Almost a 4 star....

Reviews.Title: “Good position, Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: wowlookatthat
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, triple room with balcony, metro 2 minute walk. hop on off bus stop 2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Dee2006_10
Reviews.Content: There is nowhere better to stay in Paris. Lovely, clean, comfortable rooms with a delightful staff that only wants to accommodate their guest. Located in the most perfect of locations. You can walk, take a bus, grab the metro........its all there. Cafe's too numerous too mention surrounding you. This hotel simply made my favorite city so much better. Going back year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but lacking the extra touches”
Reviews.Author: Kevlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a very late booking, consequently paid almost â‚¬300 for a deluxe room. Checked in at 3pm only to find my room wasn't ready - had to wait in the lounge for 10 minutes, wasn't offered a drink or anything else. Porter showed me up to room 51 - this was a deluxe room with terrace, something I love to have as I'm a smoker and prefer not to smoke in my room. The room itself was adequately furnished - at first glance the king size bed looked like 2 singles put together, but that turned out just to be the base and the mattress was a full kingsize. Plenty of storage room and a good-sized desk. The bathroom was unusual in that it had a large corner bath tucked away in an alcove, a shower overhead but no shower curtain. The tub itself had seen better days and didn't look very inviting. The soundproofing was perfect due to the double set of windows - ideal as this hotel is just off the busy Rue de Rivoli. Bed was comfortable, so no issues with sleep. Breakfast in the morning was a little limited due to the absence of any hot food - only after I'd finished did I notice the sign saying bacon & eggs were available on request. Plenty of rolls, fruit and cold meats, if that's your thing. I had three main gripes about this place. Firstly the charge for WiFi access - honestly, it's 2010, and really time that hotels began offering this as standard. Some do, the rest should follow. It was only â‚¬10 for 24 hours, but it's a pain having to go down to reception to get an access code. Secondly, there were no coffee-making facilities in the room. I'd expect better for a deluxe room. And thirdly, something I have never seen before in all my years of business travel: this hotel attempts to stop guests from bringing in their own food and drink, with notices in the room and stuck to the minibar. When I'm travelling, I often nip to the shops for drinks and a sandwich as I don't really like eating out alone. I walked back into the hotel with a supermarket bag full of stuff - nobody said anything but I rather wish they had. It's an argument I would have enjoyed having. Overall then, not a bad choice - very centrally located and comfortable enough, but lacking too many little things for me to choose to stay here again. Hotels like this are a dime a dozen in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: GY94109
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayfair was a welcoming and comfortable place to to stay. Our room was exceptionally quiet even being quite close to Rue Rivoli, the Tuleries park, and a cafe that stayed open quite late. The room was clean, spacious and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was huge with modernized fixtures. The staff was exceptionally kind and courteous. We would definitely stay there again as well as recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “I would without question recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: robamason
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, armed with only high school French. The employees at the Mayfair were gracious and welcoming in every interaction we had with them. The room was lovely and well-appointed, and the location (especially for a first-time visitor to Paris) was extraordinary. Their restaurant recommendations were right on the money (and didn't break the bank). I can't say enough about how lovely our time was, and one of the primary reasons was having this hotel to return to every day.

Reviews.Title: “wounderful hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: caruso402
Reviews.Content: this small hotel was very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff could not have been more helpful. especially Karen and Eric. We didn't speak french and we had no issues moving around the city with their help.. location was perfect as we walked almost everywhere. would recommennd this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtpayne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mayfair from May15-25, 2010 and thought it was wonderful. The room was great, the bed comfortable, and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast each morning was delightful and a great way to start our days activities. The location could not be better. It is near major sites and near great restaurants and public transportation. We would recommend this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure but would recommend a room on the courtyard side.

Reviews.Title: “geat hotel with friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DanielaF_8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayfair is the perfect choice to stay in Paris! It is a lovely, small and quiet hotel. The staff was more than friendly and I felt very welcome. I staid in a renovated room which was very comfortable and clean with a small balcony and a women-friendly bathroom (big mirror, bright light and good hair dryer). Before I came to the Hotel I red a comment here on Tripadvisor that made me scared about the noise: My room was right next to the elevator and it was very quiet, it is NOT true that these rooms are very noisy because of the elevator! Even from the outside it didn't hear noise because the hotel is in a small back road. The breakfast was good, they had a buffet with cold food. Hot stuff like omeletts and fired eggs is prepared freshly for the guests. I loved this French Pastry they had on the buffet! The location is just great: I reached all my business appointments easily with the Metro and in the evening I was able to do sight seeing by walk because most of the famous sights are within walking distance. This hotel is highly recommended for business traveller as well as leisure guests.

Reviews.Title: “One person can ruin your stay”
Reviews.Author: yatims
Reviews.Content: We flew in on a red eye to paris. When we reached the hotel we understood that the room would not be ready. The girl at the desk pointed to the bathroom if we want to change. When I finally was able to get into the room at 2:30 pm - it was closer to the elevator than any room I had every seen. They tried to convince me that you could hear anything - which was completely untrue. After a 45 minute discussion about the hotel being full and me telling them we were leaving the hotel - two rooms miraculously opened up. I was told I had to wait a few minutes to get the room ready. The girl at the desk forgot about me as i waited in the waiting room. The next morning - ordering a croissant - it took an hour before I called down to ask where it was and she acted like she had forgotten about the order. Unbelievable rude and inconsiderate - we left the next day and stayed at an amazing hotel - Hotel du Louve. Avoid this hotel if you see a young girl at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: OnVacationSRQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations. From the time we checked in to the time we left, the hotel staff made every effort to make our visit to Paris a memorable one. The hotel is just a block off the Rue Di Rivoli, with close access to the metro and many restaurants. We enjoyed early morning walks through the Tuileries. From there, it is only a short walk to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay and Place De La Concorde. The hotel is also in walking distance to Laduree, Galleries LaFayette and the Opera district. We stayed in a superior room facing the courtyard. The room was resonably sized with a nice bath. The courtyard is not much to look at but it provided a quiet nights sleep, especially with the windows open. Never slept better.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Naughton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mayfair This was our third visit to Paris. Our room at the Mayfair (photo) was by far the most spacious than anything previously experienced by us. Our first trip was extremely budget-conscious and we stayed in a two-star hotel in Clichy. For our second visit, we stayed in the Left Bank in a tourist hotel on the rue Mouffetard. Both visits were highly enjoyable, but I felt we spent an inordinate amount of time just getting to and from the hotels. So, this time we booked a four-night trip to Paris as a package deal but decided to upgrade the hotel, primarily for a better (more central) location in order to minimize the Metro/commuting time between hotel and restaurant, hotel and shopping, hotel and museums, etc. We decided on the Hotel Mayfair in the First Arrondissement, a little rich for our budget. However, this four-star hotel did not disappoint, and was well worth the added cost in terms of overall and intangible value. The location of the Mayfair, situated just off the rue de Rivoli, is very central and convenient to many popular sites as well as a variety of nearby Metro stations. A few hundred yards to the right (west) is Place de la Concorde and the bottom end of the Champs Elysees; directly across the rue de Rivoli is Tuileries and the Orangerie museum, and just beyond that, the Seine. To the left (east) a few hundred meters stands the Louvre. Immediately to the north is Place Vendome and the rue Saint Honore. One of the very best things about staying at the Mayfair was that, unlike our previous Paris visits, we were able to come back to our home base in mid-afternoon if need be, or pop in again to freshen up or grab an umbrella without dedicating a lot of additional time to commuting. There was also plenty of time in late afternoon to return to the hotel, to nap, bathe, and dress for dinner. The immaculate bathroom (photos) was very large, modern, and luxurious; the bedroom was (for us) elegantly appointed and very comfortable. Staff are friendly, helpful, multi-lingual, and can assist with everything from securing a restaurant reservation to booking a taxi for those travelers who are not confident enough in their French to pick up a Parisian telephone (like us). Our standard double room overlooked an airshaft (so what?) but was very tranquil, including the dawn chorus of sparrows and mourning doves singing away in the Tuileries, which was no hardship at all. Morning breakfast was outstanding, and included everything imaginable for a diverse international clientele.... from stewed prunes and mueslix for health conscious vacationers, to bacon and eggs-any-style for the Brits and Yanks, to the more predictable, yet delicious freshly baked croissants and coffee rolls, to camembert, fresh fruit, yogurts, juices, breads, etc. The Mayfair's breakfast buffet even included the deli meats and cheeses favored by Scandanavian travelers. On the down-side, if there is one, the Mayfair's close proximity to Place Vendome and the rue Saint Honore (and the luxury associated with those places) definitely added to the cost of locally-consumed meals (which, by the way were uniformly EXQUISITE). That is not to say that the area is not also dotted with affordable and excellent bistros (photo), bars, and cafes, plus a variety of very attractive ethnic Asian restaurants. The posted nightly rate for this hotel is rather steep (photo) for budget-minded travelers like us, but, as a package deal upgrade, it was worth the added costs when trying to balance hotel location against limited time.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and stylish hotel in almost perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SF_by_Air
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in the hotel and had nothing to complain about. We had a larger room with king sized bed, lovely bathroom with corner bathtub and separate toilet. Two french windows could be opened to step out on the balcony on the fifth floor with a nice view of the street and Jardin des Tuileries by the end of the street. The neighbourhood is quiet in the evenings and withing walking distance (5-20 min) from some of the best spots in Paris for shopping and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bed-and-breakfast atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: QualityMatters2Me
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair Paris is within a walk of everything from the Arch de Triumphe to the Opera to the Louvre, as well as to the Metro. Located on a side street half a block from the Rue de Rivoli, it has the "homey" atmosphere of a bed and breakfast. The staff members are very helpful, and all speak English. Our room, a newly-renovated junior suite, was quiet (it faced the small courtyard) and good-sized. The hotel had been recommended to us by a friend of a friend, and she was right--it's a great place to stay and to use as the base from which to explore, and enjoy, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Fauquier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week stay at The Mayfair. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoy small, older hotels and The Mayfair did not dissapoint - it is charming. The location makes most sites in Paris walkable and there is a Metro stop just steps away. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. GWE & CME

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ctricky
Reviews.Content: hotel has great location, service was inpecable, the staff were great, very helpfull, rooms a little small common for europe, nice size bath, clean. AAAA+++++

Reviews.Title: “A side street gem...”
Reviews.Author: alanr999
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel with surpringly large room and bath. Great location near Place de la Concorde in a fun area with lots of shops and small restaurants. Staff was extremely helpful. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Never without problems”
Reviews.Author: Caroline022
Reviews.Content: It is not the first time we stay at this hotel, which is ideally located and in a rather quiet street close to rue de Rivoli, but repetitive problems lead us to reconsider this choice. We always choose the Deluxe rooms, which are more spacious. The shower was defective in ALL the different parts that could possibly leak or sprinkle water all over the bathroom (The only seemingly spared place was precisely the bath tub!). Standard waiting time for the unique elevator is around 5 minutes, even at quiet hours, which is not understandable for a hotel of this size. The breakfast is either continental (14 euros) or buffet (20 euros) , but as a result of sophisticated unnecessary and systematically wrong mathematics by the breakfast room personnel, you always end up being charged for more than what you took in reality (even more than the buffet price, or the number of persons having breakfast!). Why dont they simply charge the buffet to everybody is a mystery. This leads to lengthy discussions at check out, re-credit of the amounts unduly charged with NEVER ANY APOLOGIES. The shower problems don't seem to impress the reception desk and you don't feel that anybody will be sent to fix them. All this would be OK for a 3*** not a 4****. If you want to stay in the neighborhood, you should rather favor the Sofitel at rue Boissy d'Anglas, which is a real 4****.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, clean and polite staff1”
Reviews.Author: HermesgirlOrlando
Reviews.Content: While this isn't the Hotel Ritz that is right around the corner...it's certainly a pleasant place to stay. Our room, while small and modest, did have a nice new bathroom, very clean and the bedding was nice. The staff were always very helpful and the breakfast was fine. Absolutely nothing to complain about at all...and we typically do stay at Ritz Carlton's...so we have pretty high standards. What is truly fantastic about the Mayfair is the location...it's walking distance to the Louvre (5 minute walk or so....super easy)...the Place Vendome (where you can pop into the Hotel Ritz for a luxurious drink)...etc....I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a place that is very clean, amazing location and doesn't mind modest yet comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but can probably do better for the same price”
Reviews.Author: ordc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a two-night stopover in Paris for our honeymoon. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly, and the location was great but overall you can probably do better for near the same price in that area. Our biggest complaint about the hotel was the temperature of the room, it was winter so the heat was on but the outside temperature was about 10C and our room was very hot. We had to leave our window open while we slept. A hot breakfast came with our room and it was OK, nothing special and certainly not worth paying extra for if you have the choice (plenty of places to go in the surrounding area). The hotel staff were generally nice, though we are still a little confused about having to leave the room key at the front desk everytime you leave the hotel. The room itself is pretty simple and old (except the remodeled bathrooms) though the bed was comfortable. Obviously, like a hotel in any major city, the rooms are small. Overall, when we return to Paris, we will stay somewhere else, mainly because from what we saw of other hotels, we feel we can probably get a nicer room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlsNj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Paris this Sept and booked a room for 7 days at Hotel Mayfair. We thought the service was very good, they offered decent dining recommendations, provided on-time wake up calls, made phone calls to restaurants we found and made our dinner reservations for us, were fairly prompt in providing us internet access and assistance when I locked myself out of the in-room safe. We ate breakfast one morning in their dining room and had room service one night. The food was fine. The room itself was spacious and I was concerned after hearing how small some European rooms were but this was a good sized room and bathroom. There were robes in the closet and decent toiletries in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. Everything was clean- every day. It is a good, basic hotel. Nothing fancy but it was comfortable, clean and pleasant. I would not hesitate to return. They are within walking distance of many major sites: Louvre, Place de Vendome, Place de Concorde, Champs Elysee and the subway is just down the block which can take you anywhere else you might want to go. There were many places to eat within easy walking distance. We had a great time in Paris and were hapyp to have a comfortable place to return to every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: TodgeProvence_France
Reviews.Content: As many other contributors have said the Hotel is in a great location. We walked (twice) from the Arc de Triomph along the Champs-Elysees and back to the hotel. Atmosphere in Paris was amazing. We chose a supier room , booked direct with Hotel, it was very comfortable and spacious, lovely large bed! nice sheets, There was some noise form the street (it comes from the rear of the hotel opposite) but hey, you are in a city, we had a balcony and after the indulgences of the night before slept very well! We shall go back. Staff were nice too. I would also add we ate two superb, albeit different restaurants, both listed on TA, the Goumard & Le Relais de L'Isle.

Reviews.Title: “Total delight”
Reviews.Author: LuchinoBrooklynNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right around the corner from Place de la Concorde, across the street from the back door of the Hotel Ritz, very close to Les Tuilleries and the Jeu de Palme, about a block and a half from the Chanel Showroom, close to Place Vendome, close to Rue St Honore. It is in one of the most exclusive and beautiful parts of Paris. The hotel management is very sensitive to the wishes of the clients. The breakfast room is filled with delicious items. There is a first floor salon for reading newspapers and planning the day. The rooms are being renovated in a charming and tasteful manner. The Concorde metro is very close. To stay here is a privilege and a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: mrsgoosestravel
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in St. Germain area but this time needed to change the location so I picked the Mayfair. It is really lovely and well run 4 star hotel, location couldn't be better, you are literally close to everything. We stayed in the Deluxe Room and it was pretty spacious for Paris and quite charming! Reception was efficient even though a warmer approach would be welcome, especially from the night staff, I know that you would prefer to be sleeping but come on! ;-) Lovely hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its best”
Reviews.Author: cmdrtuna
Reviews.Content: We were on an Air France Getaway trip to Paris and chose Hotel Mayfair because of its' location . Our choice could not have been better.This hotel epitomizes "old world charm with modern amenities".The employees courtesy, friendliness and efficiency made a lasting impression. The room was excellent with comfortable beds and luxurious bathroom.The front room mini balcany gave us a nice view foTuilleries Gardens. The front desk was very efficient and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was delicious and satisfying. The breakfast attendants were very helpful and friendly and we observed them interacting with other guests from many other countries.The cleanliness of the entire hotel was phenominal!The elevator was modern and quick.Even the old (I suppose original) elevator had been modernized and worked well.We truly felt we were welcome guests.We stayed for 6 days and the central location made it very easy to walk to the Louvre, Place Vendome, Place Concord and the Metro was very near.This hotel will certainly be one we will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly - great buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SueZQ
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Paris and I loved it even more then the first. The Mayfair was centrally located within walking distrance to everything. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and quite. The breakfast buffet was "super". They offered so that it filled us for the entire day. We grabbed a banana or apple on the way out to munch on along our way. Would definately go back and definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Many Better Hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sfwood
Reviews.Content: I get to travel a great deal for work and pleasure and have had good luck with TripAdvisor but this time I was let down. Room was small; bed was low to ground and uncomfortable; location is down a side street across from the Tuileries which is fine but not much to do in the evening. Breakfast was fine but that isn't why I choose a hotel. The staff was brisk; the amenities are scarce and it didn't feel like a good value - at all - for the equivalent of $400 a night. If you want the Louvre for a quick weekend, go for it. If you want to spend more time in Paris, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--beware of some issues”
Reviews.Author: margo1116
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at the Hotel Mayfair Paris. The location is exceptional--3 minute walk to the Concorde metro and super close to restaurants on Rue St. Honore and anywhere in the 1st. Easy walk to Louvre, Tuilieries and over the River to the Left Bank. We originally booked a Double Deluxe Room which was on the 6th floor. Spacious room, but the slanting roof was an issue for my husband who is 6 ft 2. We were awoken the next morning at 8 a.m by noisy trash trucks...and so we switched to a superior double facing the courtyard. Not much of a view, much quieter and smaller but spacious enough. There was only a 20 euro difference in price. We tried to have breakfast included since we switched to the smaller room, but we were told it would not be included. We ate breakfast at numerous cafes in the areas which I much preferred. I like exploring new places and getting the feel of an area. I agree with the other poster about the "do not put anything in the refrigerator" note. Not what I would call welcoming. I like to buy my own water, cheese and fruit but this wasn't possible. We needed to check out a day early because of illness and we were told we would still have to pay for the room. It seems that the hotel could have been more accommodating. We did spend 6 nights there. Their reason was that the hotel was full (which it obviously wasn't). Front desk was somewhat accommodating but not in a friendly way. I would return because of the cleanliness and reasonable size of the rooms and the great location. There is a 10euro/day fee for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “"You are forbidden"”
Reviews.Author: WLParker
Reviews.Content: "You are forbidden" to bring outside food or drinks into your room due to hotel room damages. You may obtain drinks from mini-bar, order room service to your room which will not cause room damages at a charge. Not allowed to store any items in mini bar other than hotel items. Great location for sights, don't be fooled by quiet location, delivery & rubbish trucks run all night , get a room in the rear. Clean, large rooms, and frenchly friendly staff. Check-in 12:00, room was not ready til 15:00, also check charges at check out. Ordered one coffee and one continental breakfast was charged for two breakfasts, too late credit card was charged.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Amenities Thin”
Reviews.Author: rykel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mayfair is in a great location for shopping and visiting the Louvre. We would recommend it generally, but beware of a few things. The one elevator that services it is extremely small and slow, we found ourselves hoofing it up 5 flights on more than one occassion after getting tired of waiting. Perhaps we are too used to the American level of service in nice hotels, but there were a few things we felt we not to our satisfaction, Air France lost one of our bags, and the hotel was not proactive at all in helping us communicate with Air France and get the bag delivered in a timely matter. The didn't go out of their way to be an advocate with the airline. Also, our in-room safe malfunctioned, and when we calle dto have someone come up and open it in the evening, we were told that the manager had left for the day and that we would have to wait until the morning. Lastly, we had supposedly equal 3 rooms, and two of them were beautiful, while one was so small that we could barely lay our suitcases open on the floor (there was no where else to put them), and had to step over them to get to the bathroom or the door. If you're used to traveling on the US, bring your own bathroom products! We found that in Europe, you're lucky to get a bar of soap! Overall, this is a nice hotel and we loved the location near the gardens and some of Paris' best shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: gazebo1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for second time. This time it was recently refurbished. The location is very good close to most of the places that you want to visit. We had continental breakfast during our stay. The cost is â‚¬14/person (quite expensive); it offers Toast, croissant, coffee, juice and yogurt. But it seems to be average for Paris hotels. As somebody else review, I would suggest to the hotel to separate the continental breakfast items from the buffet ones since this confuses and it looks like everything is available to everybody. The first day they charged us 5 euros for one egg that we took from the buffet! We didn't know that it was not inlcuded in the continental breakfast. Overall the hotel is very nice and quiet and very clean. Our room (standard) was very nice and big and the bathroom was very big too. We will stay to this hotel again! But please change the breakfast or adjust the price and include it in the price. I would go back to this hotel again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A most wonderful hotel in which to stay in on our first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: delia339
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in this incredible, most wonderful hotel. The service was better than average, the front desk personell were very friendly and helpful on our many questions. The continental breakfast was very good, and most important of all our room was very beautiful and the bed was most heavenly. Klaus at the fron desk was great in referring restaurants to go to. We will most definately make the Hotel Mayfair one of our best hotel experiences. Maurice and Shirley Lepine Fort Pierce, Florida

Reviews.Title: “this was a great hotel, good location, good breakfast, clean,and high standards.”
Reviews.Author: sharonr18
Reviews.Content: We loved the breakfast, it was recently refurbished, people at the desk spoke English and were very helpful when needed. Good location with good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in an ideal location to explore paris”
Reviews.Author: Great_Uncle_Fred
Reviews.Content: This is a good 3+ star hotel located in a quiet street close to many of the city's main attractions. Our bedroom was adequate in size, beautifully decorated and had a most comfortable kingsize bed. We were not disturbed by the rowdy night traffic being located in a back room which we appreciated even though their was no view. The marble bathroom with bath/shower combination was well lit, with good mirrors and looked fresh and clean. The only negative aspect regarding the hotel was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in our room, but we obtained hot water through room service at a small cost which relieved the situation. The second related to the cost of the taxi we ordered through the hotel to take us to the station on departure. Our taxi on arrival cost 13 euro, but our return taxi charged us 30euro!!! Seek an estimated price before you accept the ride! Overall though we are more than pleased to recommend the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SylvainCrete
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel. I have spent a week-end with my girlfriend. We are used to have week-ends escapades in all Europe, and this is really one of the nicest hotel we have discovered. We had a De Luxe room, all decorated in red harmonies, large and well furbished. The staff was very helpful and we really enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandProfessor
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful--- from the beautifully decorated and immaculate rooms to the friendly and helpful staff. We had two rooms with two bathrooms, and we were able to close and entryway door and keep the doors to our individual rooms open; thus, we had privacy but were able to communicate easily,

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: csimmonsmd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay--what a lovely truly traditional French hotel. Perfect location--close to everything--inexpensive souvenier shops abound--very safe for two women traveling alone. Close to excellent shopping and even better window shopping. Buffet breakfast was included with our package from Air France--everything was lovely and delicious. The staff was fantastic--arranged tours etc. It was great and I would definitely stay at this hotel again for the truly French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Geneva
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay. Last time I was with my family in a connecting room. This time I traveled with my 18-year-old niece, and found the hotel to be excellent again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cailin1Galway
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and this Hotel was perfect as a base for my introduction to this beautiful city. On arrival, I was greeted warmly and informed of the type of room I had booked and advised breakfast was available but not included in my booking. I was then brought to my room by the really friendly porter who covered the door/bar area every evening. He chatted every evening when I returned to the hotel which was lovely after a day sightseeing on my own. The staff at this hotel were all great and there was a lovely atmosphere. The Location of the hotel is great as you are surrounded by many of the famous sights to visit. The single room I had was very clean and plenty big for all I needed. I had heard Paris hotel rooms were not a great size but this was enough for me. The shower/bathroom was also very clean and was cleaned daily with change of towels while I was out. The only drawback was that there was no view from my room....however, I was a only a few steps from the Jardin de Tuileries with all the view I needed! I had a continental breakfast on my last morning. Toast, Roll, Yoghurt, Coffee, Juice for â‚¬14-compared to Ireland, it is a bit pricey, but this seemed to be average for the area. The service was very good at breakfast, however, I would suggest the management separate the continental breakfast items from what is on offer for the buffet breakfast. It looks like everything is available to all but looking closely at the menu, it's clear the difference of what is on offer. I heard one table appologising for taking eggs & ham when they were only meant to have the continental breakfast. This hotel is nice and quiet-I barely saw any other guests and there was no noise from outside at night time either. So, while this hotel was not Luxury accomodation, it was a great hotel for cleanliness, location and friendliness. I would go back to this hotel again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: luv2goGreensboro_NC
Reviews.Content: Somehow the Mayfair manages to be in the middle of everthing and still provide a feeling of quiet seclusion. The building and rooms are beautiful, inviting and completely updtaed. Our room could have been featured in Architectural Digest. The staff is multilingual and very helpful. We will definitely return. If you are fortunate enough to stay here do not miss Angelina's, Le Souffle', and Chez Flottes (all restaurants located very close by.)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: t_boneDallas_TXUSA
Reviews.Content: Reviewer Facts: Married couple in 40s American (Dallas, TX) Typical US Hotel stay: Ritz Carlton chain This hotel is clean and very elegantly decorated. Pros: Near Place de la Concorde & Louvre Very nice Cafe on corner for late night drinks and coffee Very, very clean Competitvely priced Near Hotel Maurice & Hotel de Crillion Cons: No large lobby or bar space (think "Luxury Boutique Hotel") Stay here again?: Absolutely My comments: Great location, VERY nice rooms (but small) @ good A/C. Very good service. English speaking. NOTE: Look on website for special last-minute rates. Note: When I told the desk manager I had a great stay, he gave me a small piece of paper with Tripadvisor.com on it and suggested I leave a review. This tells me they are concerned with making their guests happy and having a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that has got everything right”
Reviews.Author: major3
Reviews.Content: The most helpful staff we have experienced after visiting Paris every year for 10 years. Rooms spotlessly clean and comfortable. Breakfast cooked to order-so much better than buffet. Great location - quiet but with good security. Happy Travellers-London

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: I had a single room, nice and quiet, and newly renovated on the second (first) floor. For European hotel rooms, it was extremely nice, and the size was reasonable for a solo (or couple) traveler. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and spoke unaccented English (not a requirement obviously, but certainly helpful after having just arrived after a long flight). I paid EUR 180/night, which I felt was extremely reasonable for this area and quality hotel. The room also included a safe where you could leave a few things you don't feel like lugging around. As mentioned by many previous reviewers, the hotel is in a great location, off the Rue de Rivoli, and a few blocks from the Tuileries Garden and its metro stop. It is also within walking distance to many of the museums and landmarks. If you're a true walker, you can reach Notre Dame and all the way back to the Eiffel Tower, all from the somewhat centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not at all professional”
Reviews.Author: emma4646
