Reviews.Content: I had reserved at this hotel for a weekend in June but had to cancel due to bad service...hotel wanted to charge for a baby cot which has never happened to me before in all my years of traveling.When I said that I would bring my own,they said that it was not allowed: against hotel security policy. Only when I decided to cancel did I get a response from the manager telling me that I could bring my own baby cot. After all this confusion and lack of service,I decided not to stick with my reservation. All this happened in April. I'll be going to Paris this week and noticed that my credit card has an amount blocked by the Mayfair Hotel ...?? I call the hotel to tell them that I had canceled in April. No apologies. I guess they forgot to take my cancellation into consideration and went ahead to "block" money on my credit card. They tell me that it's no big deal,that I can just wait for 2 weeks until the amount gets unblocked. What kind of hotel is this? They make a mistake so they should apologize and fix their mistake.Now I'm trying to get them to unblock the money from my credit card.I must call them many times to explain and convince ...which costs me time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel....we will be back”
Reviews.Author: evernon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mayfair for a week in May and it was excellent. The staff were very friendly and spoke English fluently. The room was great. Location is on a side street off of the Tuileries so you couldn't really hear the traffic from Rue de Rivoli which runs parallel to the Tuileries. Place de la Concorde and the Louvre are a couple of blocks away and their respective Metro entries are also close. We looked into breakfast at the hotel and it was not bad for the money. I know others have said it was spendy but based on what we found in the area it was appropriate. We chose to eat at a cafe on the corner which had great omlettes. When we go back to Paris we will definately stay at this hotel again. Great staff, awesome location with close proximity to the Metro at a reasonable price. You definately cannot go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ripdog123
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Paris we were not sure what to expect from the hotel we booked online. We very pleased and delighted. The Mayfair is quaint and elegant and the service was impecable. The room was clean and nicely laid out with good nice bedroom and great shower area with a private toilet off to the side. The staff was very friendly and helpful in accomadating all our needs. The location was right near the Louvre and close to the metro to get to any sight in Paris if you were not up to walking. L'imperial CafÃ© was right next door and served some of the best food we had in Paris and the perfect place for crepÃ©s or lattÃ©s. Overall 5 stars for this gem of a find.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jadjardim
Reviews.Content: I had been planning a trip to Paris with my wife for quite some time, and obvioulsy choosing a hotel, out of so many available in Paris was a nightmare, specially after reading so many terrible reviews regarding the size of the rooms and the unpleasant staff. I ended up deciding that the location was the important factor and decided to find a hotel close to the Louvre Museum. After reading several reviews in Tripadvisor and comparing prices I decided to stay at the Mayfair, and I am glad that I did. The room was excelent, the staff very friendly and very cooperative and the location very conveniente. You are within 5 min walk from basically everything you might need - Paris Metro, Paris Open Tour Bus stop, Cityrama head office if you want to book any sightseeing tours, and even the Tourist Information center where you can buy the Museum cards etc ... Obvioulsy the Louvre and Orsay Museum are 5 min away, so is the Place de Concorde and the Champs Elysees. There are some good restaurants near by, including at leat two 3 star Michelin restaurantes in 5 min walking distance. For less expensive restaurantes I would recommend the one right next door to the hotel, which would serve these chocolate crepes that my wife loved. I would definitely go back to this hotel on my next visit. In fact I fell in love with Paris, so I will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: audiodoc1960
Reviews.Content: Friends and I had the wonderful pleasure of staying at the Hotel Mayfair for 8 nites and couldn't have asked for a better experience. We stayed in one of the family rooms (and the hotel even allowed us to choose among 2 different rooms) which was spacious and quiet and simply perfect. I have never met a friendlier or more helpful staff in all my years of travel. If we ever needed anything, not only did we not have to ask more than once, but responses were immediate. The Hotel is in the most fabulous location.. off the Rue de Rivoli, and a few blocks from the Tuileries Garden and its metro stop. It is also within walking distance to many of the museums and landmarks. This hotel is a true gem and I would certainly stay there again whenever I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem!”
Reviews.Author: allysonW
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great staff, beautiful room & ideal location. Very friendly & helpful staff. Very nice buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: someofititches
Reviews.Content: The location of this small boutique hotel is amazingly close to all of the finest attractions and shops. The staff were amazingly detailed in every way. Our bag was lost in an unknown cab. After telling the front desk of the incident, the next day it was found for us! The front desk personnel were friendly and inviting and genuinely willing to serve every request. The daily breakfast was attractive with a good variety. Don't pay big name brand prices for a luxury hotel in the heart of Paris. Try this smaller boutique hotel for a very intimate, personal luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice -great location”
Reviews.Author: wash_DCTravellover
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this hotel with two older children (17 and 21) . Booking online can be "iffy" but this turned out to be a wonderful experience.After we had booked online, we had some questions and received a prompt e-,mail response. W e booked the family room It was two connecting rooms with one shared bath. I was concerned about 4 of us using one bathroom but it worked out fine. It was right off the hotel reception area (which did not bother us). The rooms were clean and updated. Our room was large. The kids shared the smaller one, but they had plenty of room. . We walked to the hotel from the airport Roissy bus stop at place de l'Opera which was convenient. We usually stay on the left bank, but this location is terrific, especially for first time tourists. We walked everywhere, occasionally took metro and never took a cab. The reception staff are lovely and helpful. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent. We probably should have asked them for some earlier in our stay. They were also helpful with directions and things for the three day trips we took. We grabbed breakfast from the bakery around the corner,if you are interested in saving money. There are cheap cafes nearby for breakfast too. Hotel internet is expensive , but there is an internet cafe nearby if you don't mind leaving the hotel. That might bother a business person , but our son didn't care. Two twin beds pushed together is a pretty standard "king" bed in Europe if that is a concern for you. We would definitely go back. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, gracious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WillsWay15
Reviews.Content: My family - three generations - stayed at the Mayfair for a week. What a pleasure - the hotel is intimate and charming, with lovely rooms and friendly, pleasant service. The location is perfect for visiting Paris. Don't miss the delicious hot chocolate that is offered with the breakfast buffet. Around the corner is a cafe with good food, if you want to have a quiet dinner after a day of sightseeing. When we return to Paris, we will stay at the Mayfair. We had a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for your first Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: AlexDecartes
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient to Metro, the Tulieries Gardens and the Museums. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, the breakfast service was especially excellent. The building and room were on the older side, but always super clean, and the matress was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ktbug14
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in center location. Staff was friendly and very helpful; even to point of walking us out in the correct direction. First class joint, I definitely recommend for a Paris stay. It was my first time in Paris and the location couldn't have been better for sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great... depending on room selection”
Reviews.Author: av1mtl
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Mayfair Paris. We booked online and picked a Superior room with king bed, but the room they assigned was a tiny room with a double bed (2 twins together) and decoration was old and faded. Very desapointing. We switch to another room, but we had to pay for an extra (from Superior to Deluxe). The new room was a lot better, close to perfection. Don't rely only on pictures, most of them show Deluxe rooms or +, and it looks some floors have been renovated, some not. Staff was very amical and helpful. Best location in Paris (Louvre, Tuileries, Concorde, Champs, metro...). On a quiet street, which is rare in center Paris. Hotel's bar was closing very early (before 8pm).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: CalGalStavanger
Reviews.Content: Large rooms by European standards; great, helpful staff. The location is wonderful: across the street from Les Jardins Tulieries, down the street from the Louvre, and some of the best shopping is nearby. I highly recommend this property and we will definitely return if we're back in Paris! Only negatives are the charge for using Internet (and the keyboard is French/European, so it's confusing if you're American/Canadian), and breakfast is not included in the room price (20Euro extra per person for buffet).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mikicohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family . All of us liked the hospitality service and rooms Staff is ready to help whenever needed always with a smile

Reviews.Title: “Superb - Could not have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Meydo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for 6 days in a 1 bedroom suite and it was perfect. We were traveling with a 10-month old baby and looked all over the internet for a nice hotel in a decent location with a separate bedroom to accommodate the baby's sleeping schedule. The Mayfair not only had a suite available, but it was at a reasonable rate, the location was excellent (very close to the Champs Elysees, upscale shopping, Louvre and metro/bus stops), and the entire staff was first-rate. They were always eager to assist with requests in the room (iron, more towels, etc.), directions, restaurant recommendations and the baby! The room was quiet and beautifully decorated, the bed and linens were fantastic, and the baby cot was the best I have ever seen (a large pack-n-play with a crib mattress). There are so many places to stay in Paris, it is difficult to make a choice sometimes. But for us, we would stay at the Mayfair every time and recommend it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ochone
Reviews.Content: We (party of 6) visited Paris for my wife's birthday and booked Hotel Mayfair on my son's recommendation - we were not disappointed. The location was perfect, the rooms extremely comfortable and the ambience was laid-back. However the highlight of our stay for me was the friendliness of everyone of the staff. Reception, porters, breakfast staff, housekeeping and management all went out of their way to be helpful to us (in excellent English, although I did try out my schoolboy French) - this made it a special holiday for us. It is expensive - but then Paris is expensive - and I felt we got good value for our money. We will be back. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCW58
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay for ten days and can't wait to go back to the Mayfair Hotel. The staff is absolutely fanastic....they were always helpful, thoughtful and very friendly. Louisa in the breakfast room is just wonderful. I had fallen at the park and when we came back to the hotel, she helped bring me up to our room. She deserves rave reviews. The hotel is located in the best spot for sightseeing as it is close to everything. The Paris Vision tours, especially the on-off tour bus, are great and the office is not far from the hotel. We booked directly through Air France and selected the hotel from their sight. It was reasonably priced for the package. We had a room in the front of the hotel and didn't mind any traffic noises. The room was a nice size and the bathroom was roomy. We loved our stay and really wanted to be here longer. We would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mayfair Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: punky1933
Reviews.Content: We returned last evening from a 5 day stay at the Mayfair Hotel in Paris....We up-graded our room to a Deluxe Double and it was large and lovely...The whole hotel is so well run and CLEAN...We certainly have NO complaints...We enjoyed the breakfasts and they were so adequate we only ate two meals a day...The charming girl serving them was an "extra".....The location of the Mayfair is super as it is so close to so many things that you can walk to many places with no problem. It is tucked away on a side street and we never heard any noise ...The beds were comfortable and there was a small terrace off of our room..If you are looking for a lovely place to stay while in Paris, we would highly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant stay at an excellent small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: likesagoodhotel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Hotel Mayfair last month. We booked a 'Superior room' & requested King bed - we were gifted with an "upgrade" when we arrived ,so I am not sure what type of room we had but it was roomy! Very clean, comfortable, elegant decor, relatively quiet (certainly didn't disturb us) for so close to Tulleries amusement park in summer(!) - separate large bathroom w private stool closet, comfy bed... Friendly, intelligent and helpful front desk staff... Cafe ard corner is very good...Souffle Restaurant closeby is very good too! Would stay again & longer - let's just hope the dollar regains it's past value so we can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: YvetteSydney
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor Hotel Mayfair, Paris July 2008 We spent 3 nights in the hotel Mayfair and found it one of the best hotels we have stayed in Europe on our months vacation. A small, welcoming, stylish hotel set in the middle of Paris. Staff are excellent and do all they can to help. Rooms are immaculate, with beautiful decoration, mini bars, safes, large rooms and bathrooms. The beds are extremely good. The rates via the website were very reasonable for this class of hotel and location. We really enjoyed our stay here. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bessyOrangeCA
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel myself to book the room. We choose this hotel because it would sleep 3 adults I never received an email to confirm my reservation. The hotel is in a good safe location. Bathroom was good size. Shower was dreadful. Decoration were old and faded. Several stains on carpet. Safe did not work. Staff was not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ScooterTiger
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on this hotel I thought perhaps there were two Mayfair Hotels in Paris. We just returned from a one month trip to Europe where we stayed at mostly 3 star hotels or bed and breakfasts. When we arrived in Paris we were excited to stay at the Hotel Mayfair as it is a 4-star hotel. Unfortunately we were totally disappointed with the experience as it did not live up to even the qualities of a 3 star property. On the plus side, the location is really convenient. Unfortunately, that is the only plus we found. Though we had reservations, the first room they showed us was incredibly small, dingy and looked over an interior air-shaft so we declined and asked to see something else. They said another room would be available later that day. So we stored our luggage and went touring. When we returned after 5:00 pm they showed us a beautiful deluxe room that we could have for an additional 100 euros a night or a truly horrible room that was filthy (stains on the carpet and bedspread) and reeked of smoke. We negotiated and ended up with the Deluxe room for an extra 50 euros a night. Not great, but at least we could breathe while we were sleeping. Though the various gentlemen who worked at the reception desk during the evening and night were very helpful and friendly, the women who worked the desk during the daytime were incredibly rude. The concept of hospitality was completely foreign to them. Though we stayed at many wonderful places on our vacation, this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: xx_miss_piggy_xx
Reviews.Content: For my 21st birthday my boyfriend took me to Paris. I was thrilled at the thought, however slightly apprehensive as he had booked the whole holiday himself. The hotel was maybe a 30 min drive from the airport, easy enough for taxi driver to find. On arrival to the hotel, I was very impressed. I havnt had much experience of going abroad or staying in hotels, but it was lovely. The room was great! with double bed, tv, safe, bathroom and seperate toilet. It was very clean and pleasantly decorated, with small balcony. We had been listening to music on a portable player, but one day a cd player magically appeared (the cleaners must have seen we would use one). The staff were AMAZING. They were really helpful. We had some problems on arrival (my boyfriend had left his bank card at home), however we paid the first night in cash until we got the card details via phone. The staff were very approachable and friendly. The area was great, very close to the metro, some lovely restaurants and a small shop for food etc. Within walking distance to all the sites in Paris. We walked to the eiffel tower, notre dame, galerie lafayette . We didnt have any meals at the restaurant, we ate out all over Paris. It was a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Love8098
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip to Paris and this hotel was wonderful! The staff were just an incredible help from anything we needed to help finding things around the city. Always very friendly. Room was nice and clean. If you don't get a room with a view, DON'T FRET! First off, you never stay in your room anyways, second, its nice and quiet and you won't be disturbed! I've heard some people say it gets a little noisy because of the garbage pick up on the street. We had an inside room that was just fine and nice and peaceful. The hotel is has a cafe on the corner. Concord metro was right around the corner, and very much within walking distance of 2 big museums, Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. Also within CLOSE walking distance: Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysees, Jardins Tulleries, 2 major shopping malls, and much much more. It's a definite must if you want to have a nice, clean, beautiful hotel to stay at, centrally located to a lot of things!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: stevencphg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair in May 2008 for a weekend with my girlfriend. We came from Denmark and the weather in Paris was much better. The hotel is in a nice location. We prefer the area of Saint Germain but we discovered the Concorde area and it is very chic. The staff helped us find restaurants and trendy bars. I am sure we will come back to this area and to this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: AuntGigi5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Mayfair. Had a great experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I was traveling solo and the location was ideal. The hotel was close to everything and easy walking distance to most of the sights. If not the Concord Metro is very close by and a taxi stand.

Reviews.Title: “Chilly April, but warm reception!”
Reviews.Author: QueenNina
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 women just returned from Paris in April. Weather was pretty chilly & breezy, but the staff and reception at the Mayfair was great! No "snooty Parisians" here -- The location is GREAT! You can walk to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, shops on Rue de Rivoli & Rue St. Honore. Hotel rooms are small, but bathrooms were nice & large. Right next door is a great brasserie --called Cafe Imperial--that serves wonderful food at reasonable prices. In fact, we ate there so many times, the staff treated us as "regulars" --everyone was very nice to us! While in Paris, we used the Hop-on Hop-off tour bus, Batobus, and Cityrama company for a trip to Versailles. I can recommend all of the above. However, we did NOT like the tour we took with ParisVision(another sightseeing company) They left 45 minutes late & pretty much ignored us the whole time. But, we highly recommend Hotel Mayfair--we booked our air & hotel package through Air France .

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: samsaidi
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at the Hotel Mayfair on a short stay in Paris after reading the reviews and looking through their website. Our excitement was rapidly quelled however on arrival to our booked room - a junior suite. On entry to the lounge we were met by a smell of damp and wallpaper stained with mildew. We then entered the lounge area where the decoration was in a better state. However, the double bed that we had booked turned out to be 2 twin beds pushed together. We considered this to be unacceptable at at tariff of over â‚¬300 so asked for another room. We were then transferred to a standard room which at least appeared clean and dry. It is clear though that the hotel is in need of some improvement and modernisation. The room that we were moved to was small but did have a queen size bed. This redeeming feature was negated by the only pillows provided being two small squares which were only just big enough for your head. The bathroom was also in need of some repair. The shower head hose had been replaced with a cheap version that didn't hold the shower head correctly resulting in more of a garden sprinkler effect than a shower. The final insult was the view from the room. We had originally booked the suite which was meant to have a superb view of Paris. Instead we ended up with a view of the back end of the hotel in a room we didn't want. You can share this in the picture below. There was no apology from the staff who blamed the agency for not booking a double bed in our suite. This didn't quite explain why there were twin beds pushed together instead. The staff seemed friendly and mostly helpful but the state of the hotel rooms that we saw was quite honestly an embarrassment in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very practical”
Reviews.Author: Tawfiq0303
Reviews.Content: Hello, i just come back from Paris. I stayed at the Mayfair. It is not Palace but the hotel is very well situated in the centre of Paris. The rooms were not so big but very cosy and charming. For my trip it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “thanks for the reviews. Great place to stay in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: HKKW
Reviews.Content: We did a trip around Europe with my wife. Stayed at the Mayfair in Paris, and we had a great time there. Just like we pictured a hotel in Paris. Typical old Parisian style, but with all the modern facilities. The location is amazing. You are right in the heart of Paris and within walking distance of everything you need to see. The staff was very friendly. Too bad they don't have a pool, but anyway so many things to see in Paris we wouldn;t have spent a minute in it !

Reviews.Title: “a business trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: kevinkl
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris last week for business. I stayed at the Mayfair. It felt like I was on vacation ! The hotel is amazingly well located, right in the heart of Paris. So no question about visiting after work, as yo just have to step out the front gate. Will probably get back there soon for holidays. And thanks to all the staff for taking care of me so well. You made a simple business trip almost look like holidays !

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucas-Italy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair in Paris early march. I found this hotel on a specialised site and then booked direct on their own site. On a business trip, I could go everywhere, the location is really perfect. Unfortunetly, it was very hard to have a taxi. But for the rest, the people are very nice and the quality of the hotel is really worth.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Mayfair Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MemberLondonCity
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights. I booked direct on hotel's website. The hotel is in a beautiful location and the reception staff are all very helpful. We had breakfast every morning and we really liked the quality of the food they served. Our room was a de luxe, large enough and it seemed renovated, with a nice bathroom (although I would preferred a larger bath tube). All in all a very pleasant stay with very nice people. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike_CKent_England
Reviews.Content: An excellent location for this hotel. Our room was a good size. A small problem with the shower was put right immediately without fuss when reported. Staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was fine, a little expensive but you are in the middle of Paris. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OBX
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayfair is a great location for everything in the 1st. It is located on a small, quiet street a block from the Tulleries Garden, a block and a half from a good taxi stop, and 2 blocks from the metro at Place Concorde. The staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful or professional. This service extended to all staff, maids, and especially to the delightful lady serving breakfast. We might add the omelettes were very good. This is an older hotel and rooms vary, but from the rooms we saw, all are well-appoinited and comfortable. We had a twin room (hotel was full so we could not upgrade) but still had a large bathroom and deep tub. The towel heater was a nice plus. The room was extremely quiet and yet we were near all the main attractions. We feel this hotel is a very good value for Paris. This was our fourth independent visit to Paris, and although we have stayed in a more expensive hotel down the street, we preferred the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “A small paradise in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: thaihugo
Reviews.Content: We spend the first week end of june in this hotel with my wife and baby girl, and it was the most pleasant time I had in Paris. The hotel is just at walking distance of everything, and it's so nice to come back to this little escape after a stroll in the busy streets. The rooms where incredible, fully featured, and with very nice pieces of furnitures. We got our wifi connexion (I'm kind of addicted) and the staff was really helpfull, specialy for taking care of our little girl comfort. The baby craddle was brand new, and the staff managed to do everything to help us. The hotel is very quiet, and you don't hear anything from the outside or the other rooms. My only regret is that they couldn't gvie us one of the newly renovated rooms on the last floor, which get each one a different style. We could see two of them but they weren't free for the two days of our stay. The breakfast buffet is excellent, and we really spent a lovely week end there. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to stay in PARIS !”
Reviews.Author: DidierCh
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in PARIS and I found this great place. I was first interested by its location and I was amazed by this peaceful location. I will certainly go there again next time I have to stay in PARIS.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderfull week-end”
Reviews.Author: MrTommy31
Reviews.Content: Well what i can say........ we been there just before Christmas time with my lovely and sweety girlfriend and spend our trip in this small charming hotel. The staff was so kindly and the Hotel was so wonderfull. Very nice placed in the middle of the town in one of the most beatifull arrondissement of Paris. The service was excellent and we wish to get back as soon as possible. Every one was so available to help us to discover this lofvely and so romantic place that is Paris.... Thanks to all ....see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Pleasedguest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently renovated (still working on 5th & 6th floors while we were there). We could not have asked for a better location. Hotel is near everything you need. Cafes, tour companies for tours, nice restaurants, fast quick restaurants...., shopping, museums (4 of which we walked to). Everyone in the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome & comfortable. The rooms were perfect! This hotel is very nice, without being stuffy. I would like to personally say the entire staff deserve high marks!!!! Thanks to everyone there for making our 1st, but not last, trip to Paris so wonderful. Sincerely, Very Pleased Guests

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: curmudgeons
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair was a good choice because of its convient location to many cultural attractions. This is important in so far as Paris is almost always on strike(,as when we visited in Nov.)Our room was small but confortable with a good size modern bathroom. The hotel does not have a bona fide concierge and it was hit or miss at the front desk when asking for information. The hotel has true Parisan charm and the breakfast staff was most pleasant. One warning; this hotel is not within walking distance of any food market or grocery stores, so you are dependent upon local bistros and restaurants. L'Imperial has the best food in the neighborhood and a congenial staff. Although their reviews were good we found, Le Souffle to be less then wanting. Do you really want Souffle for all 3 courses? trust us no. Try the one hour cooking class at the nearby RItz hotel. Its a fun way to have a great meal --whats more you help prepare it! Paris is still one of the most charming and beautiful cities in the world even with the dollar worth almost nothing anymore in France.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneFamily60
Reviews.Content: My family and I (two adults and two small children) visited Paris in September this year. The family suite was perfect for a couple with two small children because of the second bedroom. The hotel service, and position were better than we had expected. Indeed my wife and I had been warned that the French people could on occasion appear somewhat "reserved". The staff at the Mayfair we found however to be friendly, polite, helpful and professional. Because the hotel is situated in the heart of Paris you expect to have to pay that little bit extra, but because the stay was so excellent it more than compensated. I would definately recommend this hotel as a place to stay in Paris and we are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a gift!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie050
Reviews.Content: I've dreamed of going to Paris for years and couldn't have asked for a better setting for it to come true! I had one of the recently refurbished single rooms with a balcony and it was bigger than I had expected. I felt like I was in one of the higher priced hotels in the vicinity. Location couldn't be better. A Metro stop is a short block away, excellent restaurants all around and so many sites - the Tuilieres, Louvre, Place de la Concorde - a few minutes away. Every staff member, from the maids to the general manager, couldn't have been nicer or more helpful no matter what question or need we had. I highly recommend this hotel and already miss my room and the amazing people.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mayfair in August 2007 and found this to be an excellent choice even by our own demanding criteria. It is run in a most professional manner and this was evident throughout our stay. The staff were efficient, friendly and most helpful with advice and directions. Our reservation (internet) was handled efficiently and the room ready on our arrival. The room, classified as "Superior", was spacious, clean, quiet and well furnished. On arrival we were extremely tired from many hours travelling and decided to use the on site restaurant. The menu was very limited but we were quickly served a tasty light meal. The location is central to most tourist attractions, with many within walking distance. We hope to stay again at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: BengalCat
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the 2005 reviews prompts me to write a current one. The Mayfair is not a luxury hotel but it is a very nice, clean small hotel with good service. The location is great , close to the Louvre, etc . There are several good restaurants within 2 short blocks. The staff members are all friendly and helpful. Room service was prompt. Now, as to the extra charges for breakfast-- this may have been true in 2005 but is not true now. They have a nice breakfast of cold cuts, cheese, croissants, fruit laid out and they will prepare eggs, omelettes, etc for you at no extra charge.We had the full breakfast included in our room arrangement. I would always want to stay there if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sally47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayfair as a part of our trip to France for my birthday. We had stayed in the countryside before spending the last 3 nights in Paris. We loved the countryside, and did not expect to have as quiet and restful sleeping quarters once we got to Paris. The Mayfair was a surprise. Not only was it truly quiet, though in the heart of town, it was beautifully appointed and the bed was wonderful. We could walk everywhere from the location. The staff was helpful and friendly. This will be a place we definitely come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mayfair in Paris is a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSouthsider
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous Right Bank hotel with superior service and a client-centered front office staff. The breakfast offered is very good, and the wait service is exceptional. It feels like home, which is a very comforting sense when one is abroad and rather sleep-deprived upon arrival! The rooms have had a recent updating, and are lovely. You cannot go wrong spending your Parisian vacation days at this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: _Wanderer__24242_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mayfair hotel in June 2007 for one night while traveling for business. The hotel location is very central (just off rue de Rivoli) and proximity to metro Concorde makes travel around Paris convenient. Many major sights are within easy walking distance: Tuilerie, Louvre, Place Vendome, Place Concorde, Madeleine, Opera, Champs Elysee, etc. On the other hand, hotel surrounding are rather â€œposhâ€� and there is no â€œrealâ€� Parisian life around (no boulangeries, fromageries, food shops, street markets and similar, only luxurious hotels, boutiques and offices). I booked a single room w/o breakfast for 172 euro but upon arrival was placed into a ground floor duplex consisting of two double rooms sharing the same bathroom. The room entrance was conveniently located just ten meters from the reception, but the downside was the view from the windows: into a small and dark courtyard. Room furniture was antique, not too beautiful and not very convenient, but I liked the pure and simple impression the room design left (accentuated by a flat-screen TV). The bathroom was very spacious, with a separate toilet accessible through the door from the bathroom. bathroom fixtures were modern and new. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable. Air-conditioning was functioning well. Where Mayfair is not up to its 4 star rating is with the breakfast. The selection and the quality of the offering are simply poor. No good bread, no good cheese, no good ham. No fresh vegetables. Is this hotel located in Paris? On the positive side, my omelet with champignons (has to be ordered from the staff) was quite good and not salty at all. Some fresh fruit was also available. Overall, breakfast is poor value for money and not at the level of a 4 star hotel. Hotel staff was helpful and pleasant. All in all Mayfair provides quality accommodation in the glitzy district of Paris and I would definitely stay again if someone else pays the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: mkhmiller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at The Mayfair with our family of 5. We had 2 rooms. The location was great - near the Louvre and the Metro. The lobby and main floor were very nicely appointed but once you went upstairs the the rest of the floors need to be renovated. The rooms and bathrooms were large, by French standards, and very clean. But everything - furniture, carpet, walls, bathroom tile, etc. is long overdue for an upgrade. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good service/staff, very hard mattress”
Reviews.Author: GinaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for 3 nights in mid-May. We ended up getting a Visite pass and took the RER/Metro from CDG. Very easy if you are fit and can carry your bags up and down all the stairs. It was about a 5 minute walk from the Concorde metro station to the hotel. I also strongly recommend getting a museum pass - it saved us tons of time not having to wait in lines and is a good value if you expect to see a bunch of sights. Back to the Mayfair - the staff were very friendly and welcoming - despite our poor French language skills. We skipped breakfast - 20 EU per person was ridiculous. They had English language newspapers off the lobby every day which was nice. Location was fine if this is a first trip to Paris (it wasn't for us) - Rue de Rivoli is just too touristy for us - next time we will stay near Ille St Louis or somewhere with some more character and some local markets and bakeries nearby. We did have a great early morning jog to Plaza de Concorde, down Champs de Lysee (pardon spelling errors!) to Arch de Triumphe and down the Seine. Also, being near the Concorde metro station was very convenient - we traveled all over and never had more than 2 transfers per trip. On the negative side, the beds were hard as boards - very uncomfortable. We did have a nice quiet room which faced the inside courtyard - I would definitely recommend that. all in all, it was fine but I do not think it was worth the $310 US per day in comparison to some other hotels we saw in different areas. We did have some difficulty with our safe- the directions for setting the code had been translated into English incorrectly - we hand wrote the corrections ourselves (after hotel security came up to help reset it for us) - so hopefully future guests won't meet the same fate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Service TERRIBLE COFFEE”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEPARIS2
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Mayfair at the end of a two week visit to Venice and Paris. I only spent one night but the most impressive aspect of the Mayfair is the Customer Service. Lori and the entire daytime staff treated me like an old friend. Lovely large bathroom with towel warmer and big deep bathtub. After 2 weeks of cold weather and dashing about it was a welcome relief to take a long leisurely bubble bath. There were nice bath products as well as a vanity area. The bed was a little hard but the room was spacious and lobby was charming. There is nothing that hasn't been said about the location. It's fabulous. And again the daytime staff was beyond reproach. Adorable Christmas Tree in the reception area. Very personalized services by day staff in every way. Even an umbrella stand full of nice large umbrellas available for guests. A really nice touch. The staff, particulary Lori, went out of their way. BUT: EXCEPTION: The late night auditor who was on duty the evening of December 30-very unpleasant and when I asked to purchase a 30 minute Internet Access Card he told me that all he had left were 1 hour cards. A ridiculous inconvenience and expense. I was the only one using the Business Center that night. In my opinion they should NEVER be conveniently OUT of 30 minute Access Cards. TERRIBLE COFFEE AT BREAKFAST: The most important part of my breakfast is always the coffe. The Mayfairs COFFEE IS TERRIBLE. UNDRINKABLE. I've had coffee and that is not coffee. It's a weak, dishwater messy concoction they CALL coffee. I had better coffee on the overnight Artesian Night Train from Venice. Since nobody could unintentionally make coffee that bad I came to the conclusion that the Mayfair must INTEND for it to be that bad so you don't want more. Truly terrible. MINI BAR: Prices for items in the mini bar were reasonable enough; however, there was no posting in the room OF those prices and there should be. I don't mind paying for these things when I am on vacation but what I do NOT like are surprises and the feeling that there is no full disclosure. Let's face it if you want/need a Perrier at 1AM you're going to take it from the mini bar and I loved the selection and convenience. but what I do NOT like is the feeling that something re: the prices is not properly being disclosed. Thank you for reading my review.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel and Nice People”
Reviews.Author: NestorLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris this Dec. 2006 for Christmas vacation and we stayed at the Hotel Mayfair. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel, all the staff are very friendly and they speak good english, they are so accomodating and they will even tell you where to go for good food and shopping. You should try the seafood restaurant around the corner and Angelina cafe for breakfast. We loved the food in Paris they are so delicous. When we first walked to our room the first thing we noticed was the beautiful big bathroom they have. The bathtub was huge and very clean. I would recommend to anyone to stay in this hotel. Our hotel is smack right in the middle of all the tourist spots like the Louvre, Shopping District and more they are all just walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location! Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: vuphan5
Reviews.Content: booked entire family/friends through airfrace-holidays to visit my sister. Some of us didn't eat stuff on full buffet breakfast even though lady told us that it was included, because of all the warnings from tripadvisor - but none of us (7 people) were charged the extra 6 euros - even those who ate fruit, meat & cheese. Maybe because of the loud construction going on during the day and phones in the entire building being out for the first 3 days of our stay. The hotel is clean, safe area, and wireless internet works and they didn't overcharge. The hotel staff was super friendly and accomodating (not so common among Parisians from my experience). Cafe L'Imperial on the corner is really good, reasonably-priced place to eat. Also the cafe a bock down on rue de rivoli on the way toward rue de cambon metro stop has really good cafe americana, & try chocolate fondant dessert. Central to different districts for boutique or mall shopping/sightseeing and you can even walk to most areas. If I were to visit Paris again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caverunlake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for 6 nights in Sept., thought it was excellent and would definitely stay there again. It has a very central location, an extremely pleasant staff, and is a most comfortable, enjoyable place to stay. The staff is friendly, helpful, and quite capable in English (the woman who checked us in, and the woman in the breakfast area were especially nice). Everything was handled fine including checking in and out, billing, wake-up calls, etc. The public areas were well decorated, with high ceilings and a kind of classic look. Everything was very clean, and well - polished. The hotel is relatively small and everything is relaxed and reasonably personal. Two elevators are available for the 5-6 floors. The modern elevator is sufficiently large - the other elevator is an old-fashioned circular wooden one about large enough for 1-2 people and which my wife always enjoyed using. The weather forecast is posted each day by the large elevator on the ground floor. Umbrellas ( if needed ) are available near the front desk. USA Today was available on the way to the dining area. A locked, luggage-storage room near reception is available for early arrivees ( which we were ). We liked our room. There was sufficient space, plenty of storage, and everything worked fine including the safe, TV, AC, hair dryer, hot water, shower, etc. The room was attractively decorated and furnished, and our king-sized bed was very comforable - we slept great as the hotel was quite quiet. We had requested via email for a nonsmoking room facing the street and that is what we got. Also had a small balcony large enough to hold some containers of geraniums ( this was on the 3rd floor ). The bathroom was reasonably large and housekeeping kept everything well maintained.There was a built-in adaptor for an American-style electric shaver. The showerhead could either be positioned as usual or be handheld as a spray. Everything was fairly normal, though it was an above-average step out of the tub, and although there was always plenty of fresh towels there was no sign of washclothes ( probably it's bring your own if you can't do without ). Next to the shower-bath, is a retractable " clothesline" which can be pulled out and attached to the opposite wall. One is expected to leave the room key at the front desk on each leaving of the hotel which is no big deal - one less thing to carry around all day and it probably helps with security. Our package came with the continental breakfast which we used every day and thought was convenient and satisfactory - my wife thought the hot chocolate was very good. The continental and full buffets were both located at the same serving " table", but it's easy enough to differientiate the two, since they are very adequately described on the menu at every table and the hostess also explains it. All in all, it was a very comfortable and enjoyable place to stay, in a perfect location for convenience and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Oh-la-la la-la! The Mayfair is trÃ¨s magnifique”
Reviews.Author: dandbear
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Mayfair for four nights at the beginning of August as part of a two-week Europe vacation booked on go-today. There were eight of us and we occupied four rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful at every turn. Some in our group had basic French, however, all staff were able and willing to speak with guests in English. Each of our four rooms (a combination of double twin and king bedded rooms) were classically decorated, comfortable, and super clean. The high step into the bath tub was a bit of a challenge for one of our travelers who is in her 80s - but that should be anyone's biggest issue would be a blessing. The common areas are also well decorated and clean. They are limited in size as the hotel itself is plutÃ´t petit. The continental breakfast was bountiful. We were careful about avoiding the meats and cheese from reading other reviews and upon check-in the desk clerk did explain this little quirk. The hotel even has a business centre with reasonable access fees via a pre-paid card system purchased from the front desk. As for location - well, as they say in real estate location is everything and this is a tremendous place to be when visiting Paris for your first or fifty-first time. Quick walk to the Metro and many other places you just have to visit while in the city including Le Louvre, OpÃ©ra National de Paris, the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es and almost everything else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mayfair!”
Reviews.Author: HSG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time 27 years ago and stayed at the Mayfair Hotel. We loved it then and have always wanted to return. Over the years we've been back to Paris a number of times for business but have stayed at large hotels such as the Meridian and Concorde Lafayette. Finally, when we planned to take our 16 year old granddaughter to Paris for the first time, we booked the Mayfair because we wanted her to enjoy an authentic Parisian experience. We were not disappointed! Although the hotel has been refurbished since our last stay, it still had the same small, intimate feeling but with a number of added modern conveniences (a bigger elevator and a business center to access the Internet). We stayed in a junior suite consisting of two rooms, one with a double bed the other with a sofa bed. The staff was helpful and friendly. The front desk provided recommendations for restaurants in the area that we tried and enjoyed (try Le SoufflÃ©, it was great!). The location is perfect, within walking distance to the Louve, Tuileries, Notre Dame and the Champs-Elysees. The hotel is just off Rue de Rivoli which is lined with restaurants and shops. A Metro station, which we used extensively, is a short walk from the hotel. The Mayfair was the perfect place to stay to introduce Paris to my granddaughter as it was for us 27 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF DON'T BOTHER, PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE YOU GO!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris and the city was GORGEOUS the people were a little uptight but I'd ignore that to steal a moment of their VIEWS!!. This Hotel however is a rip off. We were told Breakfast was Included and had no idea that the bowl of cereal we had was an Extra 8.00 EUROS@!! We were never told this until we checked out. The beds were HARD AS ROCK, The staff was decent but for what we paid we were expecting ...no we EASILY could have stayed in a better hotel. I would compare it to a Small Holiday Inn in Des Moines Iowa. Overall a 1 out of 5 stars..Only their rooms are twice as big. P.S. If you can go to London right after , WOW what a FUN City!!! London BLEW away Paris if you can only go to one. TRUST ME 100 PERCENT CHOOSE. London, better food, Better hotels, better SERVICE , Better EVERYTHING. The Pubs, Views, SHOPPING, it had it all. I'm so glad we ended our trip there. By the way we kind of know what were talking about we both work at the Paris here in Las Vegas. Take care and Happy Travels. Oh I almost forgot my wife told me to mention we ordered Cheese sandwiches for dinner becuase we we tired and didn't want to go out. We had 4 between the 4 of us and 2 coffees. The sandwich was 2 pieces of dry toast with a slice of cheese. total bill 42.00 EUROS!! Location was good I'll give it that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: bhutan02
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel in great location near Tuileries, Louvre, D'orsay, Place Vendome. Small but well appointed public areas; adequate but not terrific breakfast buffet; pleasant, helpful staff. The tiniest hotel room ever--a garret really. Up with the pigeons. Nice bath, but to get in and out of the bedroom, one had to turn sideways past the bureau.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and the Mayfair Hotel had come highly recommended to us. We were delighted. The location is excellent and within a pleasant walk to Arc de Triomph, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay. The hotel is situated just off Rue de Rivoli which has pleasant under-cover shopping (both souvenir shops and boutiques and upscale hotels and restaurants, casual cafes, brasseries and two bookstores, one of which is totally English. You can actually see the Eiffel Tower from this location. Watch it sparkle on the hour at night! There is a small dining room for continental breakfast (watch what comes with the room and what does not). They will serve sandwiches, salads, omelets, soup in the dining room or in your room. The staff here is excellent!! (Meet Eric at the front desk who is extremely helpful). The hotel and room were spotless. If you use an international calling card which we did, be aware that the hotel will also charge access fees. Since we are not world travelers this came as a surprise. Just know this in advance. All in all, this hotel made our first trip to Paris all the more wonderful. When we return it will be to The Mayfair Hotel!!
